subject: Marketing
title: Good-Better-Best Tiers
description: A short lesson to help you apply Good-Better-Best Tiers.

hook.text: When given three options, most people choose the middle one. Every time.

buildup.text: The compromise effect means the middle tier feels safeâ€”not too cheap, not too extravagant.

discovery.text: The basic tier exists to make the middle feel reasonable. The premium justifies the middle.

twist.text: SaaS companies design the middle tier lastâ€”after deciding what they want people to buy.

climax.text: Three tiers aren't three products. They're one product with two psychological props.

punchline.text: The middle tier is always the real offer.

quiz.question: Why do most customers choose the middle pricing tier?
options: The compromise effect makes the middle feel safe
It always offers the best value for money
Companies put the most features in the middle
